law.catch_line: Duties of retail sellers of new lead acid batteries.

text.section:
Retail sellers of new lead acid batteries shall:
Accept, if offered, used lead acid batteries, but the seller shall be required to accept only one (1) used battery for each new battery sold; and
Post notice at the place of retail sales that they are required to accept, if offered, a used lead acid battery for each new battery sold.

Wholesale sellers of new lead acid batteries shall:
Accept used lead acid batteries of the same type as the new batteries sold and in a quantity equal to the number of new batteries sold; and
Remove used lead acid batteries from the retailer's place of business no later than ninety (90) days after the retailer notifies the wholesaler that there are used lead acid batteries ready for recycling.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 2, effective July 13, 1990.
